ygData.subject: Re: po ssible weekly trade f estival...
ygData.msgSnippet: Aye, I was hunting in the Oasis when they started concoting the plan to kill the giants, can t think who it was who thought it up in the first place though...
ygData.messageBody:
Aye, I was hunting in the Oasis when they started concoting the plan to
kill the giants, can't think who it was who thought it up in the first
place though... Personally, even though I didn't attack the giants, I
loved it - the beach was empty! All the deepwater crocs were wandering
aimlessly around, not being attacked from 3 people at once as usual!

Anyone know where I can stop my second name from being repeated? Must
have signed up late one night, that's the best excuse I can think of
for why it's doubled :)

Have fun all, give me a yell if you need a shadow knight in the group
to hunt Cazic, nearly 20th at long last (15 deaths last weekend didn't
help I guess)

Khalabbil

--- SB <bbail05@...> wrote:
> From: SB <bbail05@...>
>
> >One last thing - why do people in the Oasis insist
> on training sand
> >giants into other people before they die? Can't
> they have the good
> >grace to just die AWAY from the medditating mages?
> Just something that
> >bugs me : )
>
> The worm turned on the past weekend. Fed up of
> cowering from the ever
> swarming Sand Giants, most of Oasis (about 25ppl)
> formed an agry mob by the
> pier. A quick bit of organisation saw casters and
> healers grouped, and the
> nearest Giant was swiftly pulled to his death. Not
> bad for a bunch of
> lv15 - 20s, with a lv30 or so tank. Made for some
> truly excellent
> screenshots, the poor thing didnt know who he was
> meant to be hitting as he
> swung from casters to healers to bashers and back.
>
> The following day, they had their revenge though.
> Some fool trained an SG
> onto Pillar1. Total carnage, i and many others died
> staring at their spell
> books. I believe he then went on to whack a few of
> the gawping crowd on the
> beach too, which serves em right for staring at the
> accident. :)
>
> When i got back, there were a LOT of naked people
> running around. :)
>
> Aunoa.
> Cleric of the 16th.
>
>
>
------------------------------------------------------------------------
> What do lizards and rock music have in common?
> http://www.onelist.com
> They both have communities at ONElist. Find yours
> today!
>
